trans-unit.source: Provides the base class used to serialize objects as XML streams or documents.
This class is abstract.
Extend the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> to create your own serializer to serialize and deserialize objects.

Both the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer> class and the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.NetDataContractSerializer> class inherit from the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> and are used to serialize and deserialize objects that conform to data contract rules (objects created using the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute> and the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMemberAttribute>).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> class.
This constructor is marked protected to allow derived classes to chain constructors.
Gets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> is positioned over an XML element that can be read.
This method checks if the reader is positioned on an element to read, and returns `true` if the element is the top-level element for the object found in the XML stream or document.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> implementation determines when to return `true`.
Implementations may check that they are positioned on an element or look for an expected element name.

One implementation of the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer>, the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>, checks that it is positioned on an element and also checks that the element name is the top level expected name for the type currently being deserialized.

If needed, additional attributes in the XML stream can be read while positioned on the top level element before reading XML contents using the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.ReadObject%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> used to read the XML stream or document.
`true` if the reader can read the data; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> is positioned over an XML element that can be read.
This method checks whether the reader is positioned on an element to read, and returns `true` if the element is the top-level element for the object found in the XML stream or document.
To return `true`, the found element must have an expected name.
The actual expected element name depends on the implementation of the serializer.
With the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>, the starting element is specified in the constructor of the extension class.
For an example, see the constructors for the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer> class.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> used to read the XML stream or document.
`true` if the reader is positioned over the starting element; otherwise, `false`.
Reads the XML stream or document with a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and returns the deserialized object.
This method is a virtual method, and has a default implementation that creates a dictionary reader to read the underlying stream and deserialize it.
The default implementation assumes the stream is text or XML.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> used to read the XML stream or document.
The deserialized object.
Reads the XML document or stream with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> and returns the deserialized object.
This method is a virtual method, and has a default implementation that creates a dictionary reader to read the underlying stream and deserialize it.
The default implementation assumes the stream is text or XML.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> used to read the XML document.
The deserialized object.
Reads the XML document or stream with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and returns the deserialized object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> used to read the XML stream or document.
The deserialized object.

Reads the XML stream or document with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> and returns the deserialized object; it also enables you to specify whether the serializer can read the data before attempting to read it.
The `verifyObjectName` parameter uses the same code as the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.IsStartObject%2A> method to determine whether the element is the start of the object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> used to read the XML document.
`true` to check whether the enclosing XML element name and namespace correspond to the root name and root namespace; otherwise, `false` to skip the verification.
The deserialized object.

Reads the XML document or stream with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> and returns the deserialized object; it also enables you to specify whether the serializer can read the data before attempting to read it.
The `verifyObjectName` parameter uses the same code as the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.IsStartObject%2A> method to determine whether the element is the start of the object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlReader"></xref> used to read the XML document or stream.
`true` to check whether the enclosing XML element name and namespace correspond to the root name and root namespace; `false` to skip the verification.
The deserialized object.
Writes the end of the object data as a closing XML element to the XML document or stream with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the end of the object data as a closing XML element to the XML document or stream with an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the complete content (start, content, and end) of the object to the XML document or stream with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
The object that contains the data to write to the stream.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the complete content (start, content, and end) of the object to the XML document or stream with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.

This is a virtual method and has a default implementation that calls the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.WriteStartObject%2A>, <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.WriteObjectContent%2A>, and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.WriteEndObject%2A> methods.
Because of this, this method is intended to be the most commonly used method on a serializer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the content to the XML document or stream.
The object that contains the content to write.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the complete content (start, content, and end) of the object to the XML document or stream with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.

This is a virtual method, and has a default implementation that delegates writing to the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer.WriteObject%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName> overload.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
The object that contains the content to write.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes only the content of the object to the XML document or stream using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
The object that contains the content to write.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes only the content of the object to the XML document or stream with the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document or stream.
The object that contains the content to write.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the start of the object's data as an opening XML element using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document.
The object to serialize.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
Writes the start of the object's data as an opening XML element using the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> used to write the XML document.
The object to serialize.
the type being serialized does not conform to data contract rules.
For example, the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractAttribute"></xref> attribute has not been applied to the type.
there is a problem with the instance being serialized.
the maximum number of objects to serialize has been exceeded.
Check the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer.MaxItemsInObjectGraph"></xref> property.
